name: core-selector
description:
`` is used to manage a list of elements that can be selected. The attribute `selected` indicates which item element is being selected. The attribute `multi` indicates if multiple items can be selected at once. Tapping on the item element would fire `core-activate` event. Use `core-select` event to listen for selection changes. events.name: core-select
events.description:
Fired when an item's selection state is changed. This event is fired both
when an item is selected or deselected. The `isSelected` detail property
contains the selection state.

params.name: detail.isSelected
params.description: true for selection and false for deselection

events.name: core-activate
events.description: Fired when an item element is tapped.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Gets or sets the selected element. Default to use the index of the item element. If you want a specific attribute value of the element to be used instead of index, set "valueattr" to that attribute name. Example:
In multi-selection this should be an array of values. Example:
this.$.selector.selected = ['foo', 'zot'];

attributes.name: multi
attributes.description: If true, multiple selections are allowed.

attributes.name: valueattr
attributes.description: Specifies the attribute to be used for "selected" attribute.

attributes.name: selectedClass
attributes.description: Specifies the CSS class to be used to add to the selected element.

attributes.name: selectedProperty
attributes.description:
Specifies the property to be used to set on the selected element
to indicate its active state.

attributes.name: selectedAttribute
attributes.description:
Specifies the attribute to set on the selected element to indicate
its active state.

attributes.name: selectedItem
attributes.description:
Returns the currently selected element. In multi-selection this returns
an array of selected elements.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: selectedModel
attributes.description:
In single selection, this returns the model associated with the
selected element.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: selectedIndex
attributes.description:
In single selection, this returns the selected index.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: excludedLocalNames
attributes.description:

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The target element that contains items.  If this is not set
core-selector is the container.

attributes.name: itemsSelector
attributes.description:
This can be used to query nodes from the target node to be used for selection items. Note this only works if `target` is set and is not `core-selector` itself. Example:



color = {{color}}

attributes.name: activateEvent
attributes.description:
The event that would be fired from the item element to indicate
it is being selected.

attributes.name: notap
attributes.description:
Set this to true to disallow changing the selection via the
`activateEvent`.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Returns an array of all items.
